alert.note: Alert for Inland Indian River; Okeechobee; Osceola (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 16 at 7:31PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Okeechobee, west central Indian River and southeastern Osceola Counties through 815 PM EDT... At 731 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles east of Kissimmee Prarie Preserve, or 9 miles northwest of Fort Drum, moving northeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of north central Okeechobee, west central Indian River and southeastern Osceola Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. These types of funnel clouds are harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
